zone.line: The one will itself from the other divide
The one holds in firm pleasure of life
Itself to the world, for with flaming organs
The other rises powerful in the air
from the dust
To the fields of higher air -
Both earth & heaven ruling to move
descends
?lower
Thus ascends heav to the golden vapour
And takes me away, to new various life
Yes, weere now a magic mantle mine!
And decieved it me in distant lands,
To Me m should it, around costly garments
Not fail round a kings mantle to be.
Wagner
Call
Ask not the wellknown crowd,
spreads
Which streaming itself in the atmosphere over
Of men, the thousand-folded danger
From all ends here, prepares.
From the North throngs the keen spirit tooth
To thee hereby, with arrow pointed tongue
From East draws, drying up itself here to
